articles.title: Citizen will share crime videos with the NYPD
articles.description: Mayor Eric Adams announced over the weekend that New York City will send users real-time public safety alerts based on their specific location through the crime-tracking app Citizen. The city also announced that public safety agencies, like the New York City Police Department, Fire Department, and Emergency Management, will have access to a portal to […]
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: Tesla’s long-delayed retro diner and charging location is finally opening
articles.description: Tesla’s long-in-the-works 1950s-inspired diner and drive-in Supercharger station in Los Angeles is expected to officially open today – and the company may build more of them down the line. The Tesla Diner lets people grab comfort food like burgers and fries (served in boxes shaped like Cybertrucks) and milkshakes while charging their vehicles. The Diner […]
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: Sony’s gamer-friendly X90L TV is on sale for a new low price
articles.description: If you’re excited to smash your way through the excellent Donkey Kong Banaza on the Nintendo Switch 2, you should play it on a TV that takes full advantage of the system’s ability to play games in 4K or up to 120 frames per second. Thankfully, Sony’s X90L, which checks both boxes, is currently on sale at Amazon, […]
articles.author: Brandt Ranj

articles.title: Faraday Future is back with another wild EV that probably will never get made
articles.description: Ask anyone who's familiar with EV startups what Faraday Future is, and words like vaporware or severely delayed might come to mind. That's because, in the brand's 11-year existence, it has seemingly overpromised and under-delivered on nearly everything it has ever announced. As reported by Autoweek, it has sold less than 20 of its luxury […]
articles.author: Peter Nelson

articles.title: Google solves its Pixel 10 leaks by just showing us the phone
articles.description: Google’s Pixel 10 launch event is just under a month away, but the company is already revealing the official design of the base phone. You can currently see a video of the phone on Google’s website (and below). It looks just like the official renders that leaked earlier today, which showed that the phone will […]
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: OpenAI says ChatGPT users send over 2.5 billion prompts every day
articles.description: OpenAI’s ChatGPT sees more than 2.5 billion requests daily, with 330 million from users based in the US, according to data obtained by Axios. The data suggests that ChatGPT users send over 912.5 billion requests to the AI chatbot each year. OpenAI spokesperson Rob Friedlander confirmed to The Verge that the numbers reported by Axios […]
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: Instacart’s CEO is about to take the reins of a big chunk of OpenAI
articles.description: Instacart’s CEO, Fidji Simo, will start her new role as an OpenAI executive on August 18th, leading at least one-third of the company and reporting directly to OpenAI CEO Sam Altman. Simo will be “CEO of Applications,” tasked with scaling and growing the tech’s use cases.  It’s a brand-new role, first revealed as part of […]
articles.author: Hayden Field

articles.title: Chrome will let you switch between personal and work accounts on iOS
articles.description: Google is introducing the option to easily switch between personal and work profiles in its Chrome browser on iOS, with data kept separate between the two. The new option is part of Google’s enterprise software package, and doesn’t allow non-enterprise users to switch freely between two Google accounts in the browser. Companies that adopt Chrome […]
articles.author: Dominic Preston

articles.title: Google's leaked Pixel 10 images confirm a third camera
articles.description: It appears that Google will be adding a third back camera to the base Pixel 10 this year, based on what Android Headlines reports are official renders of the rumored phone. The third camera will be a telephoto camera, Android Headlines says, with the other two cameras being a primary sensor and an ultrawide. This […]
articles.author: Jay Peters
